name: Rafael Frank
description: **13+ years of experience** in distributed systems and fullstack development. **Staff Software Engineer** driving **technical strategy**, **cross-team architecture**, and engineering quality across high-scale, mission-critical platforms (AWS, Kubernetes, Golang). Proven success in reliability improvements (e.g., reducing data loss from 4% to 0.03%) and elevating organizational engineering standards (RFCs, Mentorship).

experiences.description: Leading the vendor data management squad, responsible for the high-scale, core entry point and source of truth for vendor data across the platform, handling **millions of requests daily**.

activities.description: Authored and presented organization-wide design documents (RFCs), detailing technical strategy for complex systems, including the **Transactional Outbox pattern**, an **Idempotent SQS Consumer framework**, and a solution for handling distributed transactions using the **SAGA pattern**.

Investigated and identified a major technical debt issue in vendor availability causing unintended downtime, quantifying the potential business loss at **~5 million EUR annually**. Drove a strategic resolution by leading the **cross-team migration** of the high-impact logic to the Logistics team's stack.

Architected and implemented a generic and reusable **concurrent SQS idempotent consumer** framework, utilizing row-level locks to ensure sequential processing for single entities while maximizing parallel throughput.
Led a major refactoring of core services, **substantially improving the development experience** and **reducing the amount of weekly support requests by half**.

Drove engineering quality standards by acting as the squad's technical mentor (SOLID, Clean Arch) and **improved system reliability** by enhancing observability and producing runbooks, expediting mitigation of major incidents.
Reworked the notifications framework of the core service, dramatically **reducing the error rate and critical data loss from 4% to 0.03%**.

experiences.description: Worked on the development of a supply chain analytics and optimization platform with collaboration and automation features.

activities.description: Architected, designed, and led the development team to build a supply chain analytics platform, integrating existing optimization applications with collaboration and automation features.
Implemented critical engineering processes (SCRUM, code reviews, PRs, product roadmap planning), greatly increasing team efficiency and deliverables quality.
Dockerized and migrated ~80% of the infrastructure from bare metal to Azure Kubernetes, establishing a foundation for automated continuous releases.
Introduced and enforced an automated testing culture, integrating tests into the deployment pipeline to greatly reduce the occurrence of regressions.

experiences.description: Fullstack engineer developing Ruum by SAP, a project management tool with simple process modelling and execution features.

activities.description: Architected and implemented an end-to-end annotation-based OData API framework in NodeJS that drastically reduced the time needed to release new public APIs (estimated 40% time savings).
Architected and developed the complete webhooks system (Fullstack), allowing developers to configure, maintain, and troubleshoot integrations conveniently.
Optimized Postgres SQL queries, leading to a significant increase in overall application and public API performance.
Architected and developed many fullstack features, flexibly contributing to areas most in need to guarantee stable and steady feature releases.

experiences.description: Worked as a fullstack engineer and consultant, delivering custom tailored cloud solutions for SAP Cloud Platform and SAP Cloud ERP.

activities.description: Designed, developed, and led teams to deliver 30+ custom extensions on a variety of SAP Cloud ERP modules.
Worked closely with 20+ customers and product teams to design cloud solutions and estimate project costs.
Designed and developed frontend components and real-time charts for a strategic IoT and predictive maintenance project for a major air compressor provider.
Received an **Outstanding Performance Evaluation for 5 years in a row**, demonstrating sustained high-level contribution.

experiences.description: Co-Founder of a startup focused on creating, maintaining, and sharing marketing content on online social networks.

activities.description: Designed and developed the backend stack focusing on security, performance, and scalability using NodeJS and Postgres.
Assembled and mobilized the initial team of co-founders to further develop the idea, roadmap, and kick-start development.
Integrated the application with major social networks, allowing paying users to post content seamlessly.

awards.title: 14 Awards for Professionalism and Teamwork
awards.description: Awarded multiple times by peers for performance in delivering value to customers and teamwork.

awards.title: First Place at UFRGS Entrepreneurship Marathon (Flimbo)
awards.description: Flimbo won as the most innovative and overall most mature startup on the event.

awards.title: Products and Innovation Talent Award
awards.description: Nominated one of the talents of the year among the worldwide organization.

education.title: Software Analysis and Development (Superior - Part-Time Study)
education.institution: Universidade do Vale do Rio dos Sinos (Unisinos)

activities.description: Thesis focused on clean architecture and dependency injection.
